meanings.definition: Affected by physical or mental illness
meanings.sent1: After eating the old food, he felt sick and had to lie down.
meanings.sent2: She stayed home from school because she was sick with a cold.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs made her feel sick to her stomach.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident left a sick feeling in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the medicine was so strong, it made her feel sick instantly.

meanings.sent1: The rotten smell from the garbage can made her feel sick.
meanings.sent2: He found the horror movie so disturbing that it made him sick.
meanings.sent3: The slimy texture of the food made her feel sick to her core.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the decaying fruit left a sickening feeling in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the spoiled milk was so bad, it made her sick right away.

meanings.sent1: The skateboarder's tricks were sick, everyone cheered.
meanings.sent2: The concert was so amazing, it was sick!
meanings.sent3: His new car was sick, everyone wanted a ride in it.
meanings.sent4: The view from the mountaintop was sick, it took his breath away.
meanings.sent5: The dance moves she showed off were so sick, everyone was impressed.
